lead_paragraph: The top United Nations official in Haiti described the storm as “the largest humanitarian event” in the nation of 11 million since a devastating earthquake six years ago.

byline.contributor: Reporting was contributed by Sewell Chan, Jeremy Dupin, Elisabeth Malkin, Alan Blinder, Philip Lee Holsinger and Rick Gladstone.

headline.print_headline: Hurricane Leaves Trail of Destruction in Southern Haiti
headline.main: Hurricane Matthew Pummels Haiti and Moves Toward U.S.

snippet: The top United Nations official in Haiti described the storm as “the largest humanitarian event” in the nation of 11 million since a devastating earthquake six years ago....
abstract: Hurricane Matthew strikes Haiti, killing at least five people and injuring 10; homes and crops are destroyed and transportation is cut off; United Nations official says storm is country's 'largest humanitarian event' since 2010 earthquake.
